objects.name: RADIO SERPENS
objects.description: Radio Serpens, also known as Chafer, as an Iranian cyber espionage group responsible for widespread theft of personal information. RADIO SERPENS has been active since at least July 2014 and its activities were first exposed by Symantec in December 2015, when it was found to be conducting targeted surveillance of domestic and international targets. At the time, many of its targets were individuals located in Iran, and it had already begun compromising telecom providers as well as airline companies in the Middle East region.

objects.name: MechaFlounder
objects.description: In this campaign, RADIO SERPENS is targetting the Turkish government using a python-based payload that Unit 42 called MechaFlounder. Unit 42 believes that RADIO SERPENS uses MechaFlounder as a secondary payload that the group downloads from a first-stage payload to carry out post-exploitation activities. Unit 42 also found a domain mirroring the legitimate Turkish Scholarship government domain.
